result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges during first year of probation. If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.
Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment.
No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
Stay involved in educational or vocational program.
Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs fees and surcharges by 7-27-2016 or civil judgment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrelle Quentin Lock

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties. 

As to Count 1:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
*No new violations that rise to the level of probable cause.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Stay involved in educational or vocational program.
*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full time employment.
*Defendant to pay all costs and surcharges during first year of probation.  If unpaid a civil judgment will be ordered filed against the defendant.

As to Count 2:  Court sentences defendant to serve 4 days  in the House of Correction with credit for 4 days, a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered defendant to pay all costs fees and surcharges by 7-27-2016 or civil judgment.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
As to Counts 1 and 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

As to Count 3:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders Count 3 DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

Court orders case adjourned for sentencing to Branch 45.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea and sentencing.  Defense received a new offer and request time to review. Court orders case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Justice Point Violation Report received and filed: missed office visit on 05-28-2015. 
Court takes no action and will address the matter on 06-04-2015, defendant's next scheduled Justice Point office contact.

Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Matter before court for plea/sentencing hearing.  Defense requests additional time to review discovery with defendant.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.

Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Present in court is WCS Case Worker Katlyn Frye. 
Case in court due to violation.  Court orders defendant to report to Justice Point on March 31, 2015 at 8:30am.
 Case remains calendared for Plea/Sentencing hearing 0on 4/16/2015 in Branch 46

Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Torrie Williams for attorney Terese M. Dick.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Case in court due to Justice Point Program violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time. Court informed defendant to report to Justice Point Program for scheduled appointment on March 24, 2015. Case remains calendared for Projected guilty plea and sentencing on April 16, 2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Branch 46.
Justice Point Program violation report; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case held off the record. 
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 46. jks  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Mayfair Mall

Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Defendant Montrelle Quentin Lock in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
